title: Good...
review: One of the famous places in Ajmer. Situated near to Ana Sagar Lake. Nice view of lake from here. Such a dirty place and not maintained. We spent a little time to watch the lake.

title: Nice place to have a stroll see rats and ergets
review: Shah Jhan had built the view , u can see the marble strucure. However, the firghting or amazing thing is there are huge tarmac like structures where rats in dozens can be seen not afraid of humans. The rats eats whatever u give and also eats the baby ergets which falls from the next.

title: Beautiful Garden
review: I went to Daulat Bagh Garden. The Marble pavilions built in the premises of the Daulat Bagh Garden is a main attraction of the garden besides the beautifully bloomed flowers and tall trees which make the breeze calm and cool. It is great place to go.

title: Not upto the mark.
review: This is a place mostly taken up by the tourists coming to Dargah and is mostly taken up with hooligans.

title: Not well maintained
review: There is no ticket for this place. But this place is not maintained and it is not that much attract for the traveler.

title: The park near Lake
review: Daulat Bagh park is situated at south east corner of Ana Sagar Lake. The park is perfect to evening time with your family or friends. You can have a perfect sunset view from here. There are ferries also operated from here to reach to an island of Ana Sagar Lake, so you can enjoy the speed boat ride as well.

title: A huge expanse of greenery and view of the lake!
review: Visit near sunset or early in the morning to avoid the heat. The place is flooded with people. There are various photo spots!

title: Dolaut Bagh
review: It is an amazing place for picnic. Here you feel the enjoyment ,the art of nature ,the quality of nature ,the beauty of nature.it is an amazing place. Here many tourist are coming. It is an nice attractions for tourist.

title: Smart garden of Smart city Ajmer.
review: Lot of money has gone into reshaping this garden recently under Smart city project, which was neglected otherwise for years. Now it is worth the visit.

title: Tremendously changed
review: Recent renovation has completely changed the garden and since now they have started charging small entry fees to enter the gardens, there is very less nuisance there. The gate from Barahdari to Daulat baug has been closed as well.

title: Poor condition of the garden
review: I was very unhappy to see the worst condition of this garden. This was at one time good pace and the only biggest garden of Ajmer, shamelessly the Ajmer Municipal Administration has taken no interest to maintain this gaden

title: A garden to relax on the banks of Ana Sagar lake
review: This garden is right on the banks of Ana Sagar lake.  Visitors throng this place to spend an evening or weekend with the family.  This place makes for nice outing with the family. It is neat and clean and children can play around.  Ideal place for a great outing with the family.

title: Daulat Bagh Garden of Ajmer
review: The garden is a nice setback for the weekends to enjoy a natural retreat. It also houses a big statue of Subhash Chandra Bose and a temple. A perfect place for recreation, people can enjoy long walks and boat in the lake. Children can also enjoy the swings and toy car ride in the garden premises. You may also get a chance to enjoy evening music and dance performances by local and tribal troops in the evening on certain days.

title: Large garden
review: This is biggest garden of ajmer near Ana sagar Lake.  Several gardeners are working there but need to more carrying.

title: Big Bagh
review: Daulat Bagh garden is big garden.it is located near Ana sagar lake.This is beautiful garden.good place for family.

title: Decent place to spend an evening
review: We used to visit Daulat Bagh with our parents ages back, and now I took my kids there last week; and they seemed to enjoy every single moment of this visit.

title: Daulat Bagh
review: Daulat Bagh of Ajmer is beautiful garden. This Garden  is located near Ana Sagar lake. This is peaceful Garden.

title: Daulat Bagh
review: Daulat Bagh...must see if in Ajmer....I visited this place when was out for Ajmer Sharif from Chandigarh.

title: Daulat Bagh is the beautiful
review: This garden, which is now one of the major attractions of Ajmer, was built by the ruler Shah Jahan beautifully on the banks of the Anna Sagar Lake in Ajmer. It provides the needed open environment with the beautiful greenery. It is one of the places to visit when in Ajmer.

title: Only solace in city for tourists
review: This is the only solace for tourists in this city. Spend some 30 minutes and go for boating to island. Spend 10 minutes there and come back. A 1-hr place!

title: Garden needs maintence
review: This garden is near the Ana Sagar lake. Probably this is the coolest place to be in the city closer to the lake. The GArden needs maintenance & cleanness.

title: enjoy at daulat bagh garden
review: This garden is very beautiful situated on ana sagar lake. surrounded by full of greenery you can enjoy more at evening time while sunset. At daulat bagh you can enjoy with you family more you can feel cool and fresh air blowing. if you are visiting ajmer dont forget to visit daulat bagh garden..

title: Marbel garden
review: Great garden built by Moughal emperor one of the center of interaction in Ajmer. Especially marbel monuments. Hawkers sells flour for feeding fishes in Ana Sagar. You will find trees with lots of Squirrels. One should visit this place.

title: just a average picnic spot
review: its just like a central park with an old monument, its treated like a picnic spot. no special something about it

title: Pretty...needs maintenance though..
review: We went there in the morning, and it was quite cool...Since it was the weekend of Diwali, i guess there were more people than usual...the grass needs some upkeep and overall cleanliness will help. A couple of structures are magnificent to take pictures against them..it's also called Baradari.

title: Lovely garden by the lake
review: It's a lovely garden, almost on the very shore of Ana Sagar Lake not far from Nasiyan Jain Temple. Established even during the Mughal Emperor Jehangir. A good shady place in the midday heat. Continuation and garden decoration serve five marble pavilions called baradari, built by Shahjahan. I can't say that the garden is maintained in good order, although I saw there several gardeners.

title: Nice Gardan near Ana Sagar lake
review: Daulat Bagh is nice visiting place of ajmer.This is wonderful Gardan.This is large gardan .This gardan is good place for family and couples. This garden is very famous picnic sport of ajmer..

title: Part of Ana Lake
review: you can take a walk along the lake shore, a bit dirty and unkept, however worth a 5-10 minute of walk

title: The garden and the beauty of it
review: In the city this garden is best known due yo it s proximity to the Ana Sagar lake . The beautiful structures in the garden offer the piece of the history . The old workmanship of charming building gives a picture perfect back drop . There are generally no crowds . .

title: evening at daulat bagh
review: it is one of the places to visit when in ajmer but the garden itself is not so well maintained althogh we have  a nice view of anasagar lake from there.a place called bara dari  gives agood view.attached to this is bajrang garh atemple of lord hanuman which should be visited.well located on hieght.as u move on u can visit the chowpati and enjoy the lakeside view of anasagar

title: Nice sitting place on the edge of the lake
review: A nice evening get out for families.

title: Part of Ana Sagar Lake
review: The gardens are actually within the same grounds as Ana Sagar. An interesting place to pass away the hours.

title: Greenery within the center of city
review: Gardens surrounding the lake Ana Sagar were brought up by Jehangir. It is famous for the greenery, the flora and the freshness that anyone would want amidst the hustle bustle of the city. It provides the needed open environment with the beautiful greenery needed for recreation. The marble pavilions and the other beautiful trees adorning the beautiful garden just add to the beauty of this important landmark of Ajmer making it a must visit place. There is a big statue of Subhash chandr bos and a temple.

title: Feels Royal
review: The place is very next to Anna Sagar lake as it is sitting are next to lake so just relax and feel the silence.

title: Excellent view of Anasagar Lake, and Ajmer from Baradari.
review: Nice place to enjoy the evenings, serene view, good greenery, nice setback for weekend relaxation.

title: Visit to Daulat Bagh
review: Its awesome garden which is situated by Anasagar lake, it is a big lake which cover lots of area, boating facility is available at lake.

title: Located on the bank of anasagar lake
review: Garden Located on the bank of anasagar lake with many cenotaps.its very nice and peaceful place recommended with childrens.

title: Nice Garden
review: This garden is locate in the center of the city. Nice place to enjoy the evenings.The place is very next to Anna Sagar lake.

title: daulat Bagh Garden ajmer
review: Visit Daulat Bagh built by Shah Jahan on the banks of the Anna Sagar Lake in Ajmer to experience the jewel of Ajmer

title: Garden facing Ana Sagar lake
review: The garden had been built by emperor jahangir during 1605-1608 AD, it is good place for family picnic with garden on one side and lake on the other.

title: Couldn't find it.
review: No one, neither in  the many shops and nor in the many restaurants nor the cab wallahs seemed to know of this place - always said that it may be Daulat Khana

title: Must visit in Ajmer, Visit after 4pm....
review: How to reach: You can take a bus which stands near railway station to Baradari / Pavilions which is not more than 2km from railway station. Bus charges will be under Rs 10. Or you can even hire auto rickshaw (tuk tuk). This garden is attached to the Marble Pavilions ( locally known as Baradari, Built by Shahjahan in 1637 A.D )

title: Sprawling cool garden
review: This cool and shady garden is near Ana Sagar lake. We stayed in the Guest House just on the banks of the lake and walked across to the garden. We went with small children and they enjoyed a lot playing around. It has nicely paved path ways a midst tall shady trees. Many people are seen resting with families in the large marble pavilions facing the lake. Ajmer is such a hustle bustle city and this garden also has the quality of Ajmer - hustle bustle with many people around the garden, no quiet corner. Still I found the garden beautiful and recommended visit for all tourists.

title: Cool respite in a hot city
review: Durga Bagh is cool  lush green gardens on the banks of  Ana Sagar lake in the heart of the city Ajmer. It has very old tall trees, sprawling lawns, flowers and we walked along the shaded cool path and rested in the white marble pavilions overlooking the lake, which is the main attraction constructed by the Emperor Shah Jahan. We visited with young children and they loved playing there as Ajmer is real hot during the month of May. Many people are seen lying down and even sleeping in the pavilions, a cool respite from the hot city. A must visit place for nature lovers.

title: दौलत बाग
review: Incorrect name by trip advisor

title: A Nice Garden
review: 150 years old and charming Durga Bag Garden is located on banks of Ana Sagar Lake. This is a well known garden of Ajmer. This is a lush garden with numerous flowers and trees with sprawling lawns. Marble Pavallions built by Emperor Shah a Jahan is leading attraction.A nice visit.

title: Unmaintained
review: The park is near Ana Sagar Lake.A medium size park, basically for picnic of localites.One small temple, an open small gym and two/three rides for children are there except . No entry fee.The people throwing  use and throw plates, glasses etc after using here and there.No one there to guide you.Just take a walk around the park and come away.

title: A nice Garden in the center of the city
review: This garden is nicely locate in the center of the city..could have been maintained better but neverthless it is a place to visit .

title: Nature's love
review: Nice attraction for people looking for a natural retreat in Ajmer. Beautifully laid out garden plan. Well lit during evening. Must go if you have time.

title: Garden with some fine art
review: Daulat Bagh is garden adjacent to Barah Dari and Ana Sagar like. Place you can spend some time while visiting Bara Dari, Ana Sagar or Bajrang Garh

title: Good garden needs more maintence and claenliness
review: It was ok to visit this garden, ajmer just has very few gardens and this is omong one of the best.

title: Pavillions are of  Mughul  time and  look good to spend some time
review: Thanks to the trip adviser and the comment of the fellow traveler for highlighting this place, It helped me to visit this place and I do not regret it. Bag is located near the Ana Sagar lake. Probably this is the coolest place to be in the city closer to the lake. Like any other Indian city, Ajmer is busy, chaotic, noisy, dusty with litter being scattered everywhere. In that context, trees, flowers, gardens are really soothing however much they are not maintained.That is the case with Durga Bagh. The marble pavilons errected by mughals add enormous beauty to the bagh. British apparently had destroyed the beauty by putting up buildings here. Credit goes to the Indian government  for demolishing those concrete structures and  restoring the glory of Mughal Royal  Park. It has now been handed over to the general public. Evenings are pretty crowded  with people. They come here for strolling along the lake and sit under the marble pavilions. For a tourist, it is worthwhile to visit here for about one hour and take a rest while seeing the beauty. This is situated closer to the Nasian temple and Akbar's palace. If you intend to visit Pushkar, you are able to catch a bus from here
